cs.umass.edu.myactivitiestoolkit.view.fragments

Class AudioFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • cs.umass.edu.myactivitiestoolkit.view.fragments.AudioFragment

  • public class AudioFragment
extends Fragment
    Fragment used for interacting with the AudioService. We have already set up the permissions request for you. We also display the spectrogram of the incoming audio buffer as a heat map on an image view. You should update the UI to display the current speaker. You must set up the fragment to listen for speaker identification messages that you send from the audio service. You may make any other UI changes as you please.
    See Also:
    AudioService

      • onStart

        public void onStart()
        When the fragment starts, register a receiver to receive messages from the AudioService. The intent filter defines messages we are interested in receiving.

        Unlike the ExerciseFragment and HeartRateFragment, we do not visualize the raw data. For this reason, there is no need to listen for it from the main UI. We would, however, like to display a spectrogram of the audio data. To do this, we listen for Constants.ACTION#BROADCAST_SPECTROGRAM.

        Lastly to update the state of the audio switch properly, we listen for additional messages, using Constants.ACTION#BROADCAST_MESSAGE.
        See Also:
        Constants.ACTION, IntentFilter, LocalBroadcastManager, receiver

      • onStop

        public void onStop()
        When the fragment stops, e.g. the user closes the application or opens a new activity, then we should unregister the receiver.

      • onPermissionGranted

        public void onPermissionGranted()
        Called when the user has granted audio recording permission.

      • requestPermissions

        public void requestPermissions()
        Request permissions required for video recording. These include WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE, and CAMERA. If audio is enabled, then the RECORD_AUDIO permission is additionally required.

      • onRequestPermissionsResult

        public void onRequestPermissionsResult(int requestCode,
                                       @NonNull
                                       java.lang.String[] permissions,
                                       @NonNull
                                       int[] grantResults)
